s: Although only 35 minutes long, the debut album from The Marshall Tucker Band contains some real gems and can now be viewed as the first of many top-notch albums. The opening "Take the Highway", for me, is as good as any song the band ever did and with their arsenal, that's saying a lot.

t: The Marshall Tucker Band - Greatest Hits - Amazon.com Music
s: One of the first concerts I ever attended was in 1974, The Marshall Tucker Band opened for Jefferson Starship! Ever since I heard the band play "Can't You See" I have been a fan! This CD is an awesome and definitive collection of MTBs best songs. If you are a fan as I am, you must own this CD.

t: The Marshall Tucker Band - Wikipedia
s: April 23, 2025 - The Marshall Tucker Band is an American rock band from Spartanburg, South Carolina. Noted for incorporating blues, country and jazz into an eclectic sound, the Marshall Tucker Band helped establish the Southern rock genre in the early 1970s. Marshall Tucker Band - Where We All Belong - Amazon.com Music
s: The genre-spanning versatility and instrumental excellence of Marshall Tuckers membership is caught here in all its unfettered glory. As a live act, the band had the power to drive audiences delirious with their soaring jams, as these recordings demonstrate.
